What is the Decentralized Ethereum Bridge and how does it work?

The Decentralized Ethereum Bridge is a gateway that will soon be launched on the Verus network, allowing for seamless interaction between the Verus and Ethereum networks. This bridge will introduce a new currency called "vETH" which is a 1:1 provably mapped currency on the Verus network, available to all PBaaS chains.

The Ethereum bridge will have several key features:

**Liquidity Basket:** The bridge will include a 100% backed basket of 33% Verus, 33% Ethereum, and 33% DAI. This basket will be used for auto-conversion of fees when sending cross-chain transactions between Verus and Ethereum, based on the on-chain conversion price in the liquidity basket.

**Mapped Currencies:** The bridge will allow for the permissionless registration of *.vETH IDs, which can be used to create a "mapped currency" that can be provably mapped 1:1 to any ERC20 currency on the Ethereum network. This means that users will be able to create a token on the Verus network that is equivalent to an ERC20 token on Ethereum. Only Verus root IDs and IDs of a gateway can create mapped currencies to a gateway.

**Decentralized Launch:** The vETH bridge will launch in a decentralized and fair manner, similar to the launch of other currencies, chains, and gateways on the Verus network. The contracts will have a surplus of Verus from the fees paid to launch the gateway, which will be used to cover the Verus fees for all sends from Ethereum before the Bridge converter launches.

**Contract Surplus:** The remaining surplus of fees (5000 VRSC) will be used to launch the Bridge converter and activate the liquidity basket. This will solve the "chicken and egg" problem of having none of one currency on the other chain, allowing for seamless interaction between the two networks.

Overall, the Decentralized Ethereum Bridge will provide a powerful and decentralized gateway between the Verus and Ethereum networks, enabling new use cases and possibilities for users of both networks.
